meanings.sent1: The evidence presented was committable to the case.
meanings.sent2: The suspect's actions were committable to a crime.
meanings.sent3: The detective found the suspect's alibi committable but suspicious.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to the project was committable to her success.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's patience was committable to her students' progress.

meanings.definition: Able to be entrusted or pledged.
meanings.sent1: The valuable jewelry was committable to the safekeeping of the bank.
meanings.sent2: His trustworthy nature made him committable to important tasks.
meanings.sent3: The secret was committable to her best friend, who kept it safe.
meanings.sent4: Her loyalty was committable to her family, always putting them first.
meanings.sent5: The responsibility of the project was committable to the team leader.

meanings.definition: Suitable for being placed in a mental health facility.
meanings.sent1: The patient's behavior was committable to the psychiatric ward.
meanings.sent2: The psychiatrist deemed the individual committable for observation.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a therapy dog was committable to lift the patients' spirits.
meanings.sent4: The calming environment was committable to aiding in the recovery process.
meanings.sent5: The support group was committable to providing emotional assistance.
